snippet.title: Zack Snyder FIRES Amber Heard From Aquaman 2!!
snippet.description:

A few reports of Amber Heard being fired from Aquaman 2 have shown up on the internet, driving the entertainer to drift via online media. The reports have been exposed by The Hollywood Reporter staff author Ryan Parker, who took to online media to express that he's been told by a "dependable source" that the reports of Heard's supposed firing are "inaccurate." 

Following the rise of the reports on Sunday, Parker tweeted, "Told by a solid source that reports of Amber Heard being fired 'Aquaman 2' are inaccurate." 
 
A side project is in pre-creation and has likely been named Aquaman 2, in any case, the same experiences with respect to the film have been revealed now, of course, James Wan will be responsible for this endeavor also. A side project to the establishment, named The Trench, was earlier, really taking shape, however, it has been dropped now and it is conceivable that the eventual fate of the submerged world will be found in the forthcoming film. Amber has been keeping fans siphoned up for the following film, as she shares a few legacy minutes from when the 2018 film was on floors. 
 
A few tales and expulsion petitions later, Amber Heard is back on the Aquaman 2 set. The British entertainer, who assumed the part of Mera in DCEU's Justice League and Aquaman, will repeat her job in the spin-off of the Jason Momoa starrer. Also, her most recent Instagram post gives clues at her re-visitation of the impending DC hero film. 
 
Amber Heard's photograph on Instagram from a couple of days prior has the fans estimating that the entertainer will repeat her job as Mera in the DCEU film. She posted a photograph, where she is perched on a seat and her face is partly covered up by a book. Her hair, which is tied up with a scarf, is the shade of red. She is encircled by a couple of vanity vans too. From its vibes, the image appears to be from the set of the film. 
 
In the captions, she looked into the event where Jason Momoa, who accepts the ostensible part in the film, tore pages from her book just to stand adequately apart to be seen on the set. She added a hashtag saying that she will get a Kindle (a tablet) for Aquaman so he doesn't tear extra pages from her book. To this, Jason Momoa commented with a line of giggling emojis.
 
The DC Extended Universe is an always developing spot, which is known for keeping the moviegoing crowd on their aggregate toes. Conversations involving Zack Snyder's Justice League aren't dying down anytime soon, yet there are different significantly expected exercises diving the line. This incorporates James Wan's Aquaman 2, and entertainer Amber Heard has been prodding her return as Mera. What's more, presently she's uncovered her number one part of that character. 
 
Amber Heard appeared as Mera in the dramatic cut of Justice League, before her job was significantly extended in Aquaman. While Heard as of late repeated her job for Snyder Cut reshoots, she's likewise been advertising up Aquaman 2. 
 
As Amber Heard imparted to her 3.9 million supporters, she's come into contact with various fans who relate to her unmistakable Aquaman character. Mera as of late got some new screen time on account of Zack Snyder's Justice League. Her job was extended and incorporated a British intonation, with Mera likewise showing up in the new Knightmare grouping. 
 
While Amber Heard took part in reshoots for the Snyder Cut's dim future succession, that four-hour streaming occasion in fact isn't standard. All things considered, fans are eager to plunge once again into the Aquaman establishment with James Wan's impending spin-off.
 
While she has been building up her job for Aquaman 2, there are a few fans demanding her expulsion from the DCEU. This comes because of her ongoing fight in court with ex Johnny Depp, and Depp being terminated from his job in Fantastic Beasts 3. 
 
Aquaman 2 is right now expected to hit theaters in 2022, so creation may be starting soon. There has been a lot of theory about Amber Heard's part in Aquaman 2 lately. Unconfirmed reports keep on appearing to be on the web and across online media requesting the performer to not return as the hero Mera in Warner Bros.' spin-off of James Wan's 2018 superhuman hit, and some have suggested that she had been replaced. Regardless, Heard says such cases are all in vain.  clevver news netflix recommendations amber heard aquaman 2 celebrity news
